JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant bought CARDINAL plots of land in the Bozcaada region of GPE from a private person by way of a bill of sale .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , a land registry survey was carried out in the region , as a result of which the plots in question were registered in the name of the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant raised an objection before ORG against the land registry survey and requested its annulment .

CARDINAL . The first hearing was held on DATE . The applicant did not attend the hearings held DATE and DATE . Moreover , the hearings were adjourned DATE and DATE pending the determination of the applicant 's address by the ORG .

CARDINAL . At the hearing held on CARDINAL DATE ORG ordered an on - site inspection of the plots in question . However , the official notice for the payment of the inspection fee was only served on the applicant on DATE , and the inspection was conducted on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partially granted the applicant 's request in relation to CARDINAL of the plots in question . The court held that there was no record of ownership in the land register in respect of these CARDINAL plots and the applicant had therefore acquired title to them by way of adverse possession . The remaining CARDINAL plots , however , were registered in the ORG 's name in the land register and could not , therefore , have changed ownership by way of adverse possession . The bill of sale executed in DATE to convey the title of the disputed land was also void for the same reason . Moreover , even if the ORG had held no valid title to the plots in question , the conditions for adverse possession of unregistered land had not been fulfilled by the applicant in the instant case . The applicant , therefore , could not claim title to them . In reaching its decision ORG relied on a number of sources , including onsite inspection reports , statements from witnesses and local experts , title deeds , tax records , bills of sale , sketch plans and agricultural and technical expert reports .

CARDINAL . After holding a hearing on the merits of the case , on DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's rectification request . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
